1→-- Bootstrap lazy.nvim
     2→local lazypath = vim.fn.stdpath("data") .. "/lazy/lazy.nvim"
     3→if not (vim.uv or vim.loop).fs_stat(lazypath) then
     4→	local lazyrepo = "https://github.com/folke/lazy.nvim.git"
     5→	local out = vim.fn.system({ "git", "clone", "--filter=blob:none", "--branch=stable", lazyrepo, lazypath })
     6→	if vim.v.shell_error ~= 0 then
     7→		vim.api.nvim_echo({
     8→			{ "Failed to clone lazy.nvim:\n", "ErrorMsg" },
     9→			{ out, "WarningMsg" },
    10→			{ "\nPress any key to exit..." },
    11→		}, true, {})
    12→		vim.fn.getchar()
    13→		os.exit(1)
    14→	end
    15→end
    16→vim.opt.rtp:prepend(lazypath)
    17→
    18→-- Load config modules
    19→require("config.options")
    20→require("config.autocmds")
    21→require("config.keymaps")
    22→
    23→-- Setup lazy.nvim
    24→require("lazy").setup({
    25→	spec = { { import = "plugins" } },
    26→	defaults = { lazy = false },
    27→	checker = { enabled = true, notify = false },
    28→})
    29→

1→-- pretty-ts-errors formatter (installed via Nix)
     2→local cache = {}
     3→local cache_order = {}
     4→local bin_path = vim.env.PRETTY_TS_ERRORS_BIN or "pretty-ts-errors-markdown"
     5→
     6→local function format_ts_diagnostic(diagnostic)
     7→	if diagnostic.source ~= "ts" and diagnostic.source ~= "typescript" then
     8→		return diagnostic.message
     9→	end
    10→
    11→	local cache_key = diagnostic.message .. (diagnostic.code or "")
    12→	if cache[cache_key] then
    13→		return cache[cache_key]
    14→	end
    15→
    16→	local diagnostic_json = vim.json.encode(diagnostic)
    17→	local handle = io.popen(bin_path .. " -i '" .. diagnostic_json:gsub("'", "'\\''") .. "' 2>/dev/null")
    18→	if handle then
    19→		local prettified = handle:read("*a")
    20→		handle:close()
    21→		if prettified and prettified ~= "" then
    22→			local result = prettified:gsub("^%s*(.-)%s*$", "%1")
    23→			-- remove markdown links
    24→			result = result:gsub("%[([^%]]+)%]%(([^%)]+)%)", "%1")
    25→			-- remove codeblock markers
    26→			result = result:gsub("```%w*\n", ""):gsub("\n```", "")
    27→
    28→			if #cache_order >= 3 then
    29→				local oldest = table.remove(cache_order, 1)
    30→				cache[oldest] = nil
    31→			end
    32→			cache[cache_key] = result
    33→			table.insert(cache_order, cache_key)
    34→			return result
    35→		end
    36→	end
    37→	return diagnostic.message
    38→end
    39→
    40→-- diagnostic display config
    41→vim.diagnostic.config({
    42→	float = {
    43→		format = format_ts_diagnostic,
    44→		border = "rounded",
    45→		source = true,
    46→	},
    47→	virtual_text = {
    48→		spacing = 4,
    49→		prefix = "●",
    50→		format = function(diagnostic)
    51→			return string.format("%s", diagnostic.message:match("^[^\n]*"))
    52→		end,
    53→	},
    54→	signs = true,
    55→	underline = true,
    56→	severity_sort = true,
    57→})
    58→
    59→-- カーソルホールド時に自動でフロート表示
    60→vim.api.nvim_create_autocmd("CursorHold", {
    61→	callback = function()
    62→		vim.diagnostic.open_float(nil, { focusable = false })
    63→	end,
    64→})
    65→
    66→-- ホールド時間を短く (デフォルト4000ms → 300ms)
    67→vim.opt.updatetime = 300
    68→
    69→-- LSP configs using vim.lsp.config (Neovim 0.11+)
    70→
    71→-- vtsls (TypeScript/JavaScript)
    72→vim.lsp.config.vtsls = {
    73→	cmd = { "vtsls", "--stdio" },
    74→	filetypes = { "javascript", "javascriptreact", "typescript", "typescriptreact" },
    75→	root_markers = { "tsconfig.json", "jsconfig.json", "package.json", ".git" },
    76→	settings = {
    77→		typescript = {
    78→			preferences = {
    79→				importModuleSpecifier = "non-relative",
    80→			},
    81→		},
    82→	},
    83→}
    84→
    85→-- astro
    86→vim.lsp.config.astro = {
    87→	cmd = { "astro-ls", "--stdio" },
    88→	filetypes = { "astro" },
    89→	root_markers = { "package.json", "tsconfig.json", ".git" },
    90→}
    91→
    92→-- emmet
    93→vim.lsp.config.emmet_ls = {
    94→	cmd = { "emmet-language-server", "--stdio" },
    95→	filetypes = { "html", "css", "scss", "javascriptreact", "typescriptreact", "vue", "svelte", "astro" },
    96→	root_markers = { ".git" },
    97→}
    98→
    99→-- prisma
   100→vim.lsp.config.prismals = {
   101→	cmd = { "prisma-language-server", "--stdio" },
   102→	filetypes = { "prisma" },
   103→	root_markers = { "schema.prisma", ".git" },
   104→}
   105→
   106→-- stylelint
   107→vim.lsp.config.stylelint_lsp = {
   108→	cmd = { "stylelint-lsp", "--stdio" },
   109→	filetypes = { "css", "scss", "less", "vue", "svelte" },
   110→	root_markers = { ".stylelintrc", ".stylelintrc.json", "stylelint.config.js", ".git" },
   111→}
   112→
   113→-- svelte
   114→vim.lsp.config.svelte = {
   115→	cmd = { "svelteserver", "--stdio" },
   116→	filetypes = { "svelte" },
   117→	root_markers = { "svelte.config.js", "package.json", ".git" },
   118→}
   119→
   120→-- tailwindcss
   121→vim.lsp.config.tailwindcss = {
   122→	cmd = { "tailwindcss-language-server", "--stdio" },
   123→	filetypes = {
   124→		"html",

   137→
   138→-- html (vscode-langservers-extracted)
   139→vim.lsp.config.html = {
   140→	cmd = { "vscode-html-language-server", "--stdio" },
   141→	filetypes = { "html" },
   142→	root_markers = { ".git" },

   144→
   145→-- cssls (vscode-langservers-extracted)

   148→	filetypes = { "css", "scss", "less" },
   149→	root_markers = { ".git" },

   151→
   152→-- jsonls (vscode-langservers-extracted)
   153→vim.lsp.config.jsonls = {
   154→	cmd = { "vscode-json-language-server", "--stdio" },
   155→	filetypes = { "json", "jsonc" },
   156→	root_markers = { ".git" },
   157→}
   158→
   159→-- vue (volar)
   160→vim.lsp.config.volar = {
   161→	cmd = { "vue-language-server", "--stdio" },
   162→	filetypes = { "vue" },
   163→	root_markers = { "vue.config.js", "nuxt.config.js", "nuxt.config.ts", "package.json", ".git" },
   164→}
   165→
   166→-- yamlls
   167→vim.lsp.config.yamlls = {
   168→	cmd = { "yaml-language-server", "--stdio" },
   169→	filetypes = { "yaml", "yaml.docker-compose" },
   170→	root_markers = { ".git" },

   172→
   173→-- version-lsp
   174→vim.lsp.config.version_lsp = {

   177→	root_markers = { "package.json", "pnpm-workspace.yaml", "Cargo.toml", "go.mod", ".git" },
   178→}
   179→
   180→-- Enable all LSPs
   181→vim.lsp.enable({
   182→	"vtsls",

1→return {
     2→	{
     3→		"nvim-treesitter/nvim-treesitter",
     4→		build = ":TSUpdate",
     5→		event = { "BufReadPre", "BufNewFile" },
     6→		main = "nvim-treesitter",
     7→		init = function()
     8→			local treesitter_grammars = vim.env.TREESITTER_GRAMMARS
     9→			if treesitter_grammars then

1→return {
     2→	{
     3→		"nvim-telescope/telescope.nvim",
     4→		dependencies = {
     5→			"nvim-lua/plenary.nvim",
     6→			{ "nvim-telescope/telescope-fzf-native.nvim", build = "make" },
     7→		},
     8→		cmd = "Telescope",
     9→		keys = {
    10→			{ "<leader>ff", "<cmd>Telescope find_files<cr>", desc = "Find Files" },
    11→			{ "<leader>fg", "<cmd>Telescope live_grep<cr>", desc = "Live Grep" },
    12→			{ "<leader>fb", "<cmd>Telescope buffers<cr>", desc = "Buffers" },
    13→			{ "<leader>fr", "<cmd>Telescope oldfiles<cr>", desc = "Recent Files" },
    14→			{ "<leader>gs", "<cmd>Telescope git_status<cr>", desc = "Git Status (changed files)" },
    15→		},
    16→		config = function()
    17→			local telescope = require("telescope")
    18→			local fzf_path = vim.env.TELESCOPE_FZF_NATIVE
    19→			if fzf_path then
    20→				vim.opt.runtimepath:prepend(fzf_path)
    21→			end
    22→			telescope.setup({
    23→				defaults = {
    24→					file_ignore_patterns = { "node_modules", ".git/" },
    25→					-- neo-treeなどの特殊なウィンドウを避けてファイルを開く
    26→					get_selection_window = function()
    27→						local wins = vim.api.nvim_list_wins()
    28→						for _, win in ipairs(wins) do
    29→							local buf = vim.api.nvim_win_get_buf(win)
    30→							local ft = vim.api.nvim_get_option_value("filetype", { buf = buf })
    31→							local buftype = vim.api.nvim_get_option_value("buftype", { buf = buf })
    32→							-- 通常のバッファ（buftypeが空）で、特殊なfiletypeでないものを選択
    33→							if buftype == "" and ft ~= "neo-tree" and ft ~= "TelescopePrompt" then
    34→								return win
    35→							end
    36→						end
    37→						return 0
    38→					end,
    39→				},
    40→			})
    41→			pcall(telescope.load_extension, "fzf")
    42→		end,
    43→	},
    44→}
    45→

content.content:
# RustOwl README Content

## Overview

RustOwl is a visualization tool that analyzes Rust source code to display ownership movement and variable lifetimes. According to the documentation, "Visualize ownership and lifetimes in Rust for debugging and optimization." The tool uses color-coded underlines to represent different states:

- Green underlines indicate a variable's actual lifetime
- Blue represents immutable borrowing
- Purple shows mutable borrowing
- Orange marks moved values or function calls
- Red highlights lifetime errors

## Editor Support

RustOwl works with multiple editors:

- **VS Code and Vscodium**: Extension-based installation
- **Neovim**: Plugin available through package managers
- **Emacs**: Integration via LSP mode
- **RustRover/IntelliJ IDEs**: Third-party plugin support
- **Sublime Text**: Community-maintained integration

## Quick Start Prerequisites

The setup requires:
- `cargo` installed via rustup
- Visual Studio Code

The developers tested the guide on macOS Sequoia 15.3.2 with VS Code 1.99.3 and cargo 1.89.0.

## Neovim Configuration

Using lazy.nvim, users can add this configuration:

```lua
{
  'cordx56/rustowl',
  version = '*',
  build = 'cargo install rustowl',
  lazy = false,
  opts = {},
}
```

## VS Code Installation

The extension installs automatically from the Visual Studio Marketplace. RustOwl downloads automatically when activated. The tool analyzes code on save, with initial processing taking longer but subsequent runs benefiting from compile caching.

## Additional Resources

- Interactive playground available at play.rustowl.rs
- Discord community server for support
- Comprehensive configuration guides for each editor
- LSP specification documentation for custom client implementation

    24→    extraPackages = with pkgs; [

    66→    LAZY_DIR="$HOME/.local/share/nvim/lazy"

# RustOwl Lua Module Source Code

Here is the complete Lua source code from the file:

```lua
local M = {}

--- Enable RustOwl highlighting
---@param bufnr? number
M.enable = function(bufnr)
  require('rustowl.show-on-hover').enable(bufnr)
end

--- Disable RustOwl highlighting
---@param bufnr? number
M.disable = function(bufnr)
  require('rustowl.show-on-hover').disable(bufnr)
end

--- Toggle RustOwl highlighting on or off
---@param bufnr? number
M.toggle = function(bufnr)
  require('rustowl.show-on-hover').toggle(bufnr)
end

---@return true if rustowl highlighting is enabled
M.is_enabled = function()
  return require('rustowl.show-on-hover').is_enabled()
end

---@param opts? rustowl.Config
M.setup = function(opts)
  vim.g.rustowl = opts
end

return M
```

This module exports four primary functions for controlling RustOwl syntax highlighting behavior in Neovim, plus a configuration setup function that stores options in a global variable.

content.content:
# RustOwl Neovim Configuration - Complete Documentation

## Installation & Setup

The minimal lazy.nvim configuration requires:

```lua
{
  'cordx56/rustowl',
  version = '*',
  build = 'cargo install rustowl',
  lazy = false,
  opts = {},
}
```

## Configuration Parameters

**auto_attach** (boolean, default: true): "Automatically attach the RustOwl LSP client when opening a Rust file."

**auto_enable** (boolean, default: false): Manual activation needed unless enabled; use `:Rustowl enable` or Lua API.

**idle_time** (number, default: 500): "Time in milliseconds to hover with the cursor before triggering RustOwl analysis."

**highlight_style** (string, default: 'undercurl'): Options are 'undercurl' or 'underline' for underline presentation.

**colors** (table): Customizable highlights using hex color strings:
- lifetime: `#00cc00` (green)
- imm_borrow: `#0000cc` (blue)
- mut_borrow: `#cc00cc` (purple)
- move: `#cccc00` (yellow)
- call: `#cccc00` (yellow)
- outlive: `#cc0000` (red)

**client** (table): LSP client configuration passed to vim.lsp.start.

## Available Commands

- `:Rustowl start_client` / `stop_client` / `restart_client`
- `:Rustowl enable` / `disable` / `toggle`

Lua API: `require('rustowl').enable()`, `.disable()`, `.toggle()`, `.is_enabled()`

## Example Configurations

Full custom setup with keybindings, custom colors, and styling options are documented with complete code blocks for dark themes, init.vim compatibility, and partial color customization scenarios.

content.content:
# Complete Lua Source Code for RustOwl Config

```lua
---NOTE: `require`ing this module initializes the config

---@class rustowl.Config
---
---Whether to auto-attach the LSP client when opening a Rust file.
---Default: `true`
---@field auto_attach? boolean
---
---Enable RustOwl immediately on LspAttach
---@field auto_enable? boolean
---
---Time in milliseconds to hover with the cursor before triggering RustOwl
---@field idle_time? number
---
---The highlight style to use for underlines ('undercurl' or 'underline')
---Default: `'undercurl'`
---@field highlight_style? string
---
---Custom colors for different highlight types
---@field colors? rustowl.Colors
---
---The LSP client config (This can also be set using |vim.lsp.config()|).
---@field client? rustowl.ClientConfig

---@class rustowl.Colors
---
---Color for lifetime highlights (default: '#00cc00')
---@field lifetime? string
---
---Color for immutable borrow highlights (default: '#0000cc')
---@field imm_borrow? string
---
---Color for mutable borrow highlights (default: '#cc00cc')
---@field mut_borrow? string
---
---Color for move highlights (default: '#cccc00')
---@field move? string
---
---Color for function call highlights (default: '#cccc00')
---@field call? string
---
---Color for outlive error highlights (default: '#cc0000')
---@field outlive? string

---NOTE: This allows lua-language-server to provide users
---completions and hover when setting vim.g.rustowl directly.

---@type nil | rustowl.Config | fun():rustowl.Config
vim.g.rustowl = vim.g.rustowl

---@class rustowl.ClientConfig: vim.lsp.ClientConfig
---
---A function for determining the root directory
---@field root_dir? fun():string()?

---Internal config (defaults), merged with the user config.
---@class rustowl.internal.Config
local default_config = {
  ---@type boolean
  auto_attach = true,

  ---@type boolean
  auto_enable = false,

  ---@type number
  idle_time = 500,

  ---@type string
  highlight_style = 'undercurl',

  ---@type rustowl.Colors
  colors = {
    lifetime = '#00cc00',
    imm_borrow = '#0000cc',
    mut_borrow = '#cc00cc',
    move = '#cccc00',
    call = '#cccc00',
    outlive = '#cc0000',
  },

  ---@class rustowl.internal.ClientConfig: vim.lsp.ClientConfig

  ---
  client = {

    ---@type string[]
    cmd = { 'rustowl' },

    ---@type fun():string?
    root_dir = function()
      return vim.fs.root(0, { 'Cargo.toml', '.git' })
    end,
  },
}

local user_config = type(vim.g.rustowl) == 'function' and vim.g.rustowl() or vim.g.rustowl or {}

---@cast user_config rustowl.Config

---@type rustowl.Config
local lsp_config = type(vim.lsp.config) == 'table' and vim.lsp.config.rustowl or {}

---@type rustowl.internal.Config
local config = vim.tbl_deep_extend('force', default_config, user_config, lsp_config)

vim.validate {
  auto_attach = { config.auto_attach, 'boolean' },
  auto_enable = { config.auto_enable, 'boolean' },
  idle_time = { config.idle_time, 'number' },
  client = { config.client, { 'table' } },
  highlight_style = { config.highlight_style, 'string' },
  colors = { config.colors, 'table' },
}

-- validation for highlight_style to ensure undercurl or underline
if config.highlight_style ~= 'undercurl' and config.highlight_style ~= 'underline' then
  vim.notify(
    "Rustowl: Invalid highlight_style '" .. config.highlight_style .. "'. Using default 'undercurl'.",
    vim.log.levels.WARN
  )
  config.highlight_style = 'undercurl'
end
config.client.name = 'rustowl'
```

# Complete Lua Source Code

```lua
local M = {}

---@param filter? vim.lsp.get_clients.Filter
---@return vim.lsp.Client[]
M.get_rustowl_clients = function(filter)
  filter = vim.tbl_deep_extend('force', filter or {}, {
    name = 'rustowl',
  })
  ---@diagnostic disable-next-line: deprecated
  return type(vim.lsp.get_clients) == 'function' and vim.lsp.get_clients(filter) or vim.lsp.get_active_clients(filter)
end

---@param client vim.lsp.Client
---@param root_dir string
---@return boolean
local function is_in_workspace(client, root_dir)
  if not client.workspace_folders then
    return false
  end
  for _, dir in ipairs(client.workspace_folders) do
    if (root_dir .. '/'):sub(1, #dir.name + 1) == dir.name .. '/' then
      return true
    end
  end
  return false
end

---Compatibility for a breaking change in Nvim 0.11
--- @param client vim.lsp.Client
--- @param method string LSP method name.
--- @param params table? LSP request params.
--- @return boolean status indicating if the notification was successful. If it is false, then the client has shutdown.
local function client_notify(client, method, params)
  local info = debug.getinfo(client.notify, 'u')
  if info.nparams > 0 then
    ---@diagnostic disable-next-line: param-type-mismatch
    return client:notify(method, params)
  else
    ---@diagnostic disable-next-line: param-type-mismatch
    return client.notify(method, params)
  end
end

---@param client vim.lsp.Client
---@param root_dir string
local function notify_workspace_folder(client, root_dir)
  if is_in_workspace(client, root_dir) then
    return
  end
  local workspace_folder = { uri = vim.uri_from_fname(root_dir), name = root_dir }
  local params = {
    event = {
      added = { workspace_folder },
      removed = {},
    },
  }
  client_notify(client, 'workspace/didChangeWorkspaceFolders', params)
  if not client.workspace_folders then
    client.workspace_folders = {}
  end
  table.insert(client.workspace_folders, workspace_folder)
end

---Start / attach the LSP client
---@return integer|nil client_id The LSP client ID
M.start = function()
  local config = require('rustowl.config')
  local root_dir = config.client.root_dir()
  if not root_dir then
    vim.schedule(function()
      vim.notify('rustowl: Failed to detect root_dir.', vim.log.levels.ERROR)
    end)
    return
  end

  for _, client in ipairs(M.get_rustowl_clients()) do
    if not is_in_workspace(client, root_dir) then
      -- Attach to existing session
      notify_workspace_folder(client, root_dir)
      vim.lsp.buf_attach_client(0, client.id)
      return
    end
  end

  ---@param client vim.lsp.Client
  local notify_workspace_folder_hook = function(client)
    notify_workspace_folder(client, root_dir)
  end
  local on_init = type(config.client.on_init) == 'function'
      and function(...)
        notify_workspace_folder_hook(...)
        config.client.on_init(...)
      end
    or notify_workspace_folder_hook
  ---@type vim.lsp.ClientConfig
  local client_config = vim.tbl_deep_extend('force', config.client, { root_dir = root_dir, on_init = on_init })
  return vim.lsp.start(client_config)
end

---Compatibility for a breaking change in Nvim 0.11
---@param client vim.lsp.Client
---@return boolean
local function client_is_stopped(client)
  local info = debug.getinfo(client.is_stopped, 'u')
  if info.nparams > 0 then
    ---@diagnostic disable-next-line: param-type-mismatch
    return client:is_stopped()
  else
    ---@diagnostic disable-next-line: missing-parameter
    return client.is_stopped()
  end
end

M.stop = function()
  local clients = M.get_rustowl_clients()
  vim.lsp.stop_client(clients)
  local t, err, _ = vim.uv.new_timer()
  local timer = assert(t, err)
  local max_attempts = 50
  local attempts_to_live = max_attempts
  local stopped_client_count = 0
  timer:start(200, 100, function()
    for _, client in ipairs(clients) do
      if client_is_stopped(client) then
        stopped_client_count = stopped_client_count + 1
      end
    end
    if stopped_client_count >= #clients then
      timer:stop()
      attempts_to_live = 0
    elseif attempts_to_live <= 0 then
      vim.schedule(function()
        vim.notify(
          ('rustowl: Could not stop all LSP clients after %d attempts.'):format(max_attempts),
          vim.log.levels.ERROR
        )
      end)
      timer:stop()
      attempts_to_live = 0
    end
    attempts_to_live = attempts_to_live - 1
  end)
end

M.restart = function()
  M.stop()
  M.start()
end

return M
```

# Lua Source Code

```lua
local M = {}

local hl_ns = vim.api.nvim_create_namespace('rustowl')

---@param line number
---@param col number
---@param bufnr? number
function M.enable(line, col, bufnr)
  local lsp = require('rustowl.lsp')
  bufnr = bufnr or vim.api.nvim_get_current_buf()
  local clients = lsp.get_rustowl_clients { bufnr = bufnr }
  local params = {
    position = { line = line - 1, character = col },
    document = vim.lsp.util.make_text_document_params(),
  }

  for _, client in ipairs(clients) do
    client:request('rustowl/cursor', params, function(_, result, _)
      if result ~= nil then
        for _, deco in ipairs(result['decorations']) do
          if not deco['overlapped'] then
            local start = { deco['range']['start']['line'], deco['range']['start']['character'] }
            local finish = { deco['range']['end']['line'], deco['range']['end']['character'] }
            local opts = { regtype = 'v', inclusive = false }
            vim.highlight.range(bufnr, hl_ns, deco['type'], start, finish, opts)
          end
        end
      end
    end, bufnr)
  end
end

---@param bufnr? number
function M.disable(bufnr)
  vim.api.nvim_buf_clear_namespace(bufnr or 0, hl_ns, 0, -1)
end

return M
```

This module provides highlighting functionality for a Neovim plugin, exposing two public functions: one that enables cursor-based decorations via LSP requests, and another that clears all highlights from a buffer.

# RustOwl Lua Module - Complete Source Code

```lua
local M = {}

local state = {
  augroup = nil,
}

function M.is_enabled()
  return state.augroup ~= nil
end

function M.enable_on_lsp_attach()
  local augroup = vim.api.nvim_create_augroup('RustOwlLspAttach', {})

  vim.api.nvim_create_autocmd('LspAttach', {
    group = augroup,
    callback = function(event)
      M.enable(event.buf)
    end,
  })
end

--- Enable RustOwl highlighting
---@param bufnr? number
function M.enable(bufnr)
  local lsp = require('rustowl.lsp')
  if #lsp.get_rustowl_clients() == 0 then
    lsp.start()
  end
  local idle_time_ms = assert(require('rustowl.config').idle_time)

  local timer = nil

  local function clear_timer()
    if timer then
      timer:stop()
      timer:close()
      timer = nil
    end
  end

  local function start_timer()
    clear_timer()
    local t, err = vim.uv.new_timer()
    timer = t
    assert(timer, err)

    timer:start(
      idle_time_ms,
      0,
      vim.schedule_wrap(function()
        local line, col = unpack(vim.api.nvim_win_get_cursor(0))
        require('rustowl.highlight').enable(line, col, bufnr)
      end)
    )
  end

  state.augroup = vim.api.nvim_create_augroup('RustOwl', { clear = true })

  vim.api.nvim_create_autocmd({ 'CursorMoved', 'CursorMovedI' }, {
    group = state.augroup,
    buffer = bufnr,
    callback = function()
      require('rustowl.highlight').disable(bufnr)
      start_timer()
    end,
  })

  vim.api.nvim_create_autocmd('BufUnload', {
    group = state.augroup,
    buffer = bufnr,
    callback = clear_timer,
  })

  start_timer()
end

--- Disable RustOwl highlighting
---@param bufnr? number
function M.disable(bufnr)
  require('rustowl.highlight').disable(bufnr)

  if M.is_enabled() then
    vim.api.nvim_del_augroup_by_id(state.augroup)
  end

  state.augroup = nil
end

--- Toggle RustOwl highlighting on or off
---@param bufnr? number
function M.toggle(bufnr)
  local action = M.is_enabled() and M.disable or M.enable
  action(bufnr)
end

return M
```

## Neovim Configuration Exploration Report

I've thoroughly explored the Neovim configuration in your repository. Here's a comprehensive breakdown:

### 1. Directory Structure

```
nvim/
├── init.lua                    # Bootstrap lazy.nvim + load config modules
├── lazy-lock.json              # Lock file for reproducible plugin loads
└── lua/
    ├── config/
    │   ├── options.lua         # vim.opt settings (lines, colors, editor behavior)
    │   ├── keymaps.lua         # Key bindings (LSP, window nav, etc.)
    │   └── autocmds.lua        # Autocommands
    └── plugins/                # 27 plugin configuration files
        ├── autopairs.lua
        ├── autotag.lua
        ├── avante.lua          # AI assistant
        ├── blink-cmp.lua       # Completion engine
        ├── bufferline.lua      # Tab bar
        ├── conform.lua         # Formatter
        ├── copilot.lua         # GitHub Copilot
        ├── git-conflict.lua
        ├── gitsigns.lua        # Git integration
        ├── kanagawa.lua        # Theme
        ├── lspconfig.lua       # LSP configuration (19 language servers!)
        ├── lualine.lua         # Status line
        ├── maketable.lua
        ├── neo-tree.lua        # File explorer
        ├── neogit.lua          # Git UI
        ├── noice.nvim          # UI enhancement
        ├── nvim-lint.lua       # Linter
        ├── oil.lua             # File browser
        ├── pnpm-catalog-lens.lua
        ├── snacks.lua          # Dashboard + utilities
        ├── telescope.lua       # Fuzzy finder
        ├── treesitter.lua      # Syntax parsing
        ├── wakatime.lua        # Time tracking
        └── which-key.lua       # Keymap display
```

### 2. Lazy.nvim Setup Pattern

The repository uses **lazy.nvim** as the plugin manager with this pattern:

**In `init.lua`:**
```lua
-- 1. Bootstrap lazy.nvim (auto-clone if missing)
local lazypath = vim.fn.stdpath("data") .. "/lazy/lazy.nvim"

-- 2. Load config modules
require("config.options")
require("config.keymaps")
require("config.autocmds")

-- 3. Setup lazy.nvim with plugin specs
require("lazy").setup({
    spec = { { import = "plugins" } },  -- Auto-loads all files in lua/plugins/
    defaults = { lazy = false },        -- Don't lazy-load by default
    checker = { enabled = true, notify = false },
})
```

Each plugin file returns a table (or list of tables) with this structure:

```lua
return {
    {
        "owner/plugin-name",           -- Plugin GitHub repo
        lazy = false,                  -- Load immediately (default: lazy-load)
        event = "VeryLazy",           -- Load on event (BufReadPre, VeryLazy, etc.)
        cmd = "CommandName",          -- Load on command invocation
        keys = { ... },               -- Load on key binding
        dependencies = { ... },       -- Load before this plugin
        priority = 1000,              -- Load order (higher = sooner)
        build = ":TSUpdate",          -- Build hook
        config = function() ... end,  -- Configuration code
        opts = { ... },               -- Options passed to plugin setup
    }
}
```

### 3. Common Plugin Configuration Patterns

**Minimal plugin (no config):**
```lua
return {
    "github/copilot.vim",
}
```

**With options:**
```lua
return {
    "saghen/blink.cmp",
    opts = {
        keymap = { preset = "enter" },
        completion = { documentation = { auto_show = true } },
        sources = { default = { "lsp", "path", "snippets", "buffer" } },
    },
}
```

**With full config function:**
```lua
return {
    "windwp/nvim-autopairs",
    config = function()
        require("nvim-autopairs").setup({
            disable_filetype = { "TelescopePrompt", "vim" },
        })
    end,
}
```

**With dependencies and keymaps:**
```lua
return {
    "nvim-telescope/telescope.nvim",
    dependencies = {
        "nvim-lua/plenary.nvim",
        { "nvim-telescope/telescope-fzf-native.nvim", build = "make" },
    },
    cmd = "Telescope",
    keys = {
        { "<leader>ff", "<cmd>Telescope find_files<cr>", desc = "Find Files" },
        -- ...
    },
    config = function()
        -- Setup code
    end,
}
```

### 4. LSP Configuration (Important for Rust!)

**File:** `/home/yuta/ghq/github.com/yutakobayashidev/dotnix/nvim/lua/plugins/lspconfig.lua`

This file uses **Neovim 0.11+ native LSP config** (NOT nvim-lspconfig plugin). It configures 16 language servers:

Current servers:
- **TypeScript/JavaScript:** vtsls
- **Web:** astro, emmet, prisma, stylelint, svelte, tailwindcss, html, css, json, vue, yaml
- **Utilities:** version-lsp (for version files)
- Also enables: eslint

**Important:** There is NO Rust LSP configured yet. The LSP section recognizes `Cargo.toml` as a root marker for `version_lsp`, but no Rust-specific server (rust-analyzer) is set up.

### 5. Nix Integration for Neovim

**File:** `/home/yuta/ghq/github.com/yutakobayashidev/dotnix/nix/modules/home/programs/neovim.nix`

This Nix module:
- Provides **treesitter grammars** via environment variable `TREESITTER_GRAMMARS`
- Provides **telescope-fzf-native** via environment variable
- Installs **language servers and formatters** via `extraPackages`:
  - Formatters: `prettierd`, `eslint_d`
  - Language servers: `vtsls`, astro-ls, emmet-ls, prisma-ls, stylelint-lsp, svelte-ls, tailwindcss-ls, vscode-langservers-extracted, vue-ls, yaml-ls
  - Utilities: `pretty-ts-errors-markdown`, `version-lsp`

**Missing for Rust:** No `rust-analyzer`, `rustfmt`, or `clippy` in the Nix packages.

### 6. Conform.nvim (Formatter Integration)

**File:** `/home/yuta/ghq/github.com/yutakobayashidev/dotnix/nvim/lua/plugins/conform.lua`

Currently handles formatting for:
- JavaScript/TypeScript: `eslint_d` → `prettierd`
- CSS/SCSS/Less: `prettierd`
- HTML/JSON/YAML/Markdown: `prettierd`

**Missing for Rust:** No `rustfmt` formatter configured.

### 7. LSP Diagnostic Display

The `lspconfig.lua` file also includes custom diagnostic formatting for TypeScript using the `pretty-ts-errors-markdown` binary (installed via Nix).

### 8. Available Plugins Summary

**UI/Navigation:**
- neo-tree (file explorer)
- telescope (fuzzy finder)
- snacks (dashboard)
- oil (file browser)

**Editing:**
- blink.cmp (completion)
- autopairs, autotag
- conform (formatting)
- nvim-lint (linting)

**Git:**
- gitsigns, neogit, git-conflict, diffview

**Status/Appearance:**
- lualine (status line)
- bufferline (tabs)
- kanagawa (theme)
- noice (UI enhancements)

**AI/Copilot:**
- copilot.vim
- avante.nvim (AI assistant with Copilot backend)

**Development:**
- treesitter (syntax parsing)
- which-key (keymap help)
- wakatime (time tracking)

### Key Takeaways for Rust Support

1. **LSP Setup:** Uses Neovim 0.11+ native LSP config (vim.lsp.config), NOT nvim-lspconfig
2. **Nix-Managed:** Language servers and tools are installed via Nix, not by Neovim plugins
3. **No Rust yet:** Zero Rust configuration in LSP, formatters, or Nix packages
4. **Pattern to follow:** Mirror the existing TypeScript setup (vtsls → vim.lsp.config.rust_analyzer)
5. **Nix packages needed:** Add `rust-analyzer`, `rustfmt` to neovim.nix extraPackages
6. **Conform setup:** Add rustfmt to conform.lua formatters_by_ft
7. **Optional:** Could add clippy linting via nvim-lint

This is a modern, clean setup leveraging Nix for dependency management and lazy.nvim for plugin management!

```lua
return {
    "github/copilot.vim",
}
```

**With options:**
```lua
return {
    "saghen/blink.cmp",
    opts = {
        keymap = { preset = "enter" },
        completion = { documentation = { auto_show = true } },
        sources = { default = { "lsp", "path", "snippets", "buffer" } },
    },
}
```

**With full config function:**
```lua
return {
    "windwp/nvim-autopairs",
    config = function()
        require("nvim-autopairs").setup({
            disable_filetype = { "TelescopePrompt", "vim" },
        })
    end,
}
```

**With dependencies and keymaps:**
```lua
return {
    "nvim-telescope/telescope.nvim",
    dependencies = {
        "nvim-lua/plenary.nvim",
        { "nvim-telescope/telescope-fzf-native.nvim", build = "make" },
    },
    cmd = "Telescope",
    keys = {
        { "<leader>ff", "<cmd>Telescope find_files<cr>", desc = "Find Files" },
        -- ...
    },
    config = function()
        -- Setup code
    end,
}
```

### 4. LSP Configuration (Important for Rust!)

**File:** `/home/yuta/ghq/github.com/yutakobayashidev/dotnix/nvim/lua/plugins/lspconfig.lua`

This file uses **Neovim 0.11+ native LSP config** (NOT nvim-lspconfig plugin). It configures 16 language servers:

Current servers:
- **TypeScript/JavaScript:** vtsls
- **Web:** astro, emmet, prisma, stylelint, svelte, tailwindcss, html, css, json, vue, yaml
- **Utilities:** version-lsp (for version files)
- Also enables: eslint

**Important:** There is NO Rust LSP configured yet. The LSP section recognizes `Cargo.toml` as a root marker for `version_lsp`, but no Rust-specific server (rust-analyzer) is set up.

### 5. Nix Integration for Neovim

**File:** `/home/yuta/ghq/github.com/yutakobayashidev/dotnix/nix/modules/home/programs/neovim.nix`

This Nix module:
- Provides **treesitter grammars** via environment variable `TREESITTER_GRAMMARS`
- Provides **telescope-fzf-native** via environment variable
- Installs **language servers and formatters** via `extraPackages`:
  - Formatters: `prettierd`, `eslint_d`
  - Language servers: `vtsls`, astro-ls, emmet-ls, prisma-ls, stylelint-lsp, svelte-ls, tailwindcss-ls, vscode-langservers-extracted, vue-ls, yaml-ls
  - Utilities: `pretty-ts-errors-markdown`, `version-lsp`

**Missing for Rust:** No `rust-analyzer`, `rustfmt`, or `clippy` in the Nix packages.

### 6. Conform.nvim (Formatter Integration)

**File:** `/home/yuta/ghq/github.com/yutakobayashidev/dotnix/nvim/lua/plugins/conform.lua`

Currently handles formatting for:
- JavaScript/TypeScript: `eslint_d` → `prettierd`
- CSS/SCSS/Less: `prettierd`
- HTML/JSON/YAML/Markdown: `prettierd`

**Missing for Rust:** No `rustfmt` formatter configured.

### 7. LSP Diagnostic Display

The `lspconfig.lua` file also includes custom diagnostic formatting for TypeScript using the `pretty-ts-errors-markdown` binary (installed via Nix).

### 8. Available Plugins Summary

**UI/Navigation:**
- neo-tree (file explorer)
- telescope (fuzzy finder)
- snacks (dashboard)
- oil (file browser)

**Editing:**
- blink.cmp (completion)
- autopairs, autotag
- conform (formatting)
- nvim-lint (linting)

**Git:**
- gitsigns, neogit, git-conflict, diffview

**Status/Appearance:**
- lualine (status line)
- bufferline (tabs)
- kanagawa (theme)
- noice (UI enhancements)

**AI/Copilot:**
- copilot.vim
- avante.nvim (AI assistant with Copilot backend)

**Development:**
- treesitter (syntax parsing)
- which-key (keymap help)
- wakatime (time tracking)

### Key Takeaways for Rust Support

1. **LSP Setup:** Uses Neovim 0.11+ native LSP config (vim.lsp.config), NOT nvim-lspconfig
2. **Nix-Managed:** Language servers and tools are installed via Nix, not by Neovim plugins
3. **No Rust yet:** Zero Rust configuration in LSP, formatters, or Nix packages
4. **Pattern to follow:** Mirror the existing TypeScript setup (vtsls → vim.lsp.config.rust_analyzer)
5. **Nix packages needed:** Add `rust-analyzer`, `rustfmt` to neovim.nix extraPackages
6. **Conform setup:** Add rustfmt to conform.lua formatters_by_ft
7. **Optional:** Could add clippy linting via nvim-lint

This is a modern, clean setup leveraging Nix for dependency management and lazy.nvim for plugin management!

content.content:
# Rustowl Neovim Plugin - Lua Source Code

Here is the complete Lua source code from the provided file:

```lua
local config = require('rustowl.config')

if not vim.g.loaded_rustowl then
  vim.g.loaded_rustowl = true

  local highlight_style = config.highlight_style or 'undercurl'

  local default_colors = {
    lifetime = '#00cc00',
    imm_borrow = '#0000cc',
    mut_borrow = '#cc00cc',
    move = '#cccc00',
    call = '#cccc00',
    outlive = '#cc0000',
  }

  -- Ensure all color keys are present even if user provides a partial table
  local highlights = vim.tbl_deep_extend('keep', config.colors or {}, default_colors)

  for hl_name, color in pairs(highlights) do
    local options = { default = true, sp = color }
    if highlight_style == 'underline' then
      options.underline = true
    else
      options.undercurl = true
    end
    vim.api.nvim_set_hl(0, hl_name, options)
  end

  vim.api.nvim_create_user_command('Rustowl', function(opts)
    if vim.bo[0].filetype ~= 'rust' then
      vim.notify('Rustowl: Current buffer is not a rust file.', vim.log.levels.ERROR)
      return
    end
    local fargs = opts.fargs
    local cmd = fargs[1]
    if cmd == 'start_client' then
      require('rustowl.lsp').start()
    elseif cmd == 'stop_client' then
      require('rustowl.lsp').stop()
    elseif cmd == 'restart_client' then
      require('rustowl.lsp').restart()
    elseif cmd == 'enable' then
      require('rustowl').enable()
    elseif cmd == 'disable' then
      require('rustowl').disable()
    elseif cmd == 'toggle' then
      require('rustowl').toggle()
    end
  end, {
    nargs = '+',
    desc = 'Starts, stops the rustowl LSP client',
    complete = function(arg_lead, cmdline, _)
      local lsp = require('rustowl.lsp')
      local rustowl = require('rustowl')
      local clients = lsp.get_rustowl_clients()
      local commands = {}
      if #clients == 0 then
        table.insert(commands, 'start_client')
      else
        table.insert(commands, 'toggle')
        if rustowl.is_enabled() then
          table.insert(commands, 'disable')
        else
          table.insert(commands, 'enable')
        end
        table.insert(commands, 'stop_client')
        table.insert(commands, 'restart_client')
      end
      if cmdline:match('^Rustowl%s+%w*$') then
        return vim.tbl_filter(function(command)
          return command:find(arg_lead) ~= nil
        end, commands)
      end
    end,
  })

  -- Send analyze request on save
  local analyze_augroup = vim.api.nvim_create_augroup('RustOwlAnalyzeOnSave', { clear = false })
  vim.api.nvim_create_autocmd('BufWritePost', {
    group = analyze_augroup,
    buffer = 0,
    desc = 'RustOwl: send rustowl/analyze on save',
    callback = function(args)
      -- Only send when rustowl is enabled
      local rustowl = require('rustowl')
      if not rustowl.is_enabled() then
        return
      end
      local lsp = require('rustowl.lsp')
      local clients = lsp.get_rustowl_clients { bufnr = args.buf }
      for _, client in ipairs(clients) do
        client:request('rustowl/analyze', {}, function() end, args.buf)
      end
    end,
  })
end

if config.auto_enable then
  require('rustowl.show-on-hover').enable_on_lsp_attach()
end

if config.auto_attach then
  require('rustowl.lsp').start()
end
```

content.text:
Now I have the complete picture. Here is a comprehensive summary of RustOwl.

---

## 1. What RustOwl Does

**RustOwl** (`cordx56/rustowl`) is a visualization tool for Rust that analyzes source code and displays **ownership movement** and **variable lifetimes** using color-coded underlines in your editor. It operates as a custom LSP server (not rust-analyzer -- it is its own separate server binary called `rustowl`).

The color scheme:
- **Green** (`#00cc00`) -- variable lifetime (how long a value lives)
- **Blue** (`#0000cc`) -- immutable borrow (`&T`)
- **Purple** (`#cc00cc`) -- mutable borrow (`&mut T`)
- **Yellow** (`#cccc00`) -- move / function call
- **Red** (`#cc0000`) -- outlive errors (lifetime violations)

The workflow: you write Rust code, save the file, and RustOwl analyzes it. When you hover your cursor over a variable, it shows the ownership/lifetime annotations as colored underlines beneath the relevant code spans.

---

## 2. How the Neovim Plugin/Integration Works

RustOwl's Neovim integration is built directly into the same repository (it is a Neovim plugin structured with `lua/` and `ftplugin/` directories). It works as follows:

**Architecture:**
- **LSP Client** (`lua/rustowl/lsp.lua`): Starts/attaches a custom LSP client that communicates with the `rustowl` binary. It uses `vim.lsp.start()` with the command `{ 'rustowl' }` and detects the project root via `Cargo.toml` or `.git`.
- **Show-on-Hover** (`lua/rustowl/show-on-hover.lua`): Sets up `CursorMoved`/`CursorMovedI` autocmds with a debounce timer (default 500ms). When the cursor stops moving, it sends a custom LSP request `rustowl/cursor` with the cursor position.
- **Highlight** (`lua/rustowl/highlight.lua`): Receives the LSP response containing decoration data (ranges + types like `lifetime`, `imm_borrow`, `mut_borrow`, `move`, `call`, `outlive`) and applies them using `vim.highlight.range()` in a dedicated namespace.
- **ftplugin** (`ftplugin/rust.lua`): Entry point that runs when a Rust file is opened. It sets up highlight groups, creates the `:Rustowl` user command, registers a `BufWritePost` autocmd to send `rustowl/analyze` on save, and optionally auto-attaches/auto-enables.

**Custom LSP methods used:**
- `rustowl/analyze` -- sent on file save to trigger analysis
- `rustowl/cursor` -- sent on cursor hover to get decorations for the current position

**Commands available:**
- `:Rustowl start_client` / `stop_client` / `restart_client` -- manage the LSP server
- `:Rustowl enable` / `disable` / `toggle` -- control highlighting

---

## 3. Neovim Plugin Setup (lazy.nvim)

**Minimal configuration:**

```lua
{
  'cordx56/rustowl',
  version = '*',       -- use latest tagged release
  build = 'cargo install rustowl',  -- install the binary
  lazy = false,
  opts = {},
}
```

**Full configuration with all options:**

```lua
{
  'cordx56/rustowl',
  version = '*',
  build = 'cargo install rustowl',
  lazy = false,
  opts = {
    -- Auto-attach LSP client when opening a Rust file (default: true)
    auto_attach = true,

    -- Auto-enable highlighting on LspAttach (default: false)
    -- If false, you must manually run :Rustowl enable
    auto_enable = false,

    -- Debounce time in ms before triggering analysis on cursor hover (default: 500)
    idle_time = 500,

    -- 'undercurl' or 'underline' (default: 'undercurl')
    highlight_style = 'undercurl',

    -- Custom colors (all optional, shown with defaults)
    colors = {
      lifetime   = '#00cc00',  -- green
      imm_borrow = '#0000cc',  -- blue
      mut_borrow = '#cc00cc',  -- purple
      move       = '#cccc00',  -- yellow
      call       = '#cccc00',  -- yellow
      outlive    = '#cc0000',  -- red
    },

    -- LSP client config (passed to vim.lsp.start)
    client = {
      cmd = { 'rustowl' },
      root_dir = function()
        return vim.fs.root(0, { 'Cargo.toml', '.git' })
      end,
    },
  },
}
```

**Key behavioral notes:**
- With `auto_attach = true` (default), the `rustowl` LSP client starts automatically when you open a Rust file.
- With `auto_enable = false` (default), you must manually run `:Rustowl enable` or `:Rustowl toggle` to activate the underline visualizations. If you set `auto_enable = true`, highlighting activates automatically on LSP attach.
- The `build = 'cargo install rustowl'` step compiles and installs the `rustowl` binary from crates.io. This requires `cargo` via rustup.
- The plugin uses its own namespace (`rustowl`) for highlights, so it does not interfere with other LSP clients like rust-analyzer. You can (and should) run both simultaneously.

1→-- pretty-ts-errors formatter (installed via Nix)
     2→local cache = {}
     3→local cache_order = {}
     4→local bin_path = vim.env.PRETTY_TS_ERRORS_BIN or "pretty-ts-errors-markdown"
     5→
     6→local function format_ts_diagnostic(diagnostic)
     7→	if diagnostic.source ~= "ts" and diagnostic.source ~= "typescript" then
     8→		return diagnostic.message
     9→	end
    10→
    11→	local cache_key = diagnostic.message .. (diagnostic.code or "")
    12→	if cache[cache_key] then
    13→		return cache[cache_key]
    14→	end
    15→
    16→	local diagnostic_json = vim.json.encode(diagnostic)
    17→	local handle = io.popen(bin_path .. " -i '" .. diagnostic_json:gsub("'", "'\\''") .. "' 2>/dev/null")
    18→	if handle then
    19→		local prettified = handle:read("*a")
    20→		handle:close()
    21→		if prettified and prettified ~= "" then
    22→			local result = prettified:gsub("^%s*(.-)%s*$", "%1")
    23→			-- remove markdown links
    24→			result = result:gsub("%[([^%]]+)%]%(([^%)]+)%)", "%1")
    25→			-- remove codeblock markers
    26→			result = result:gsub("```%w*\n", ""):gsub("\n```", "")
    27→
    28→			if #cache_order >= 3 then
    29→				local oldest = table.remove(cache_order, 1)
    30→				cache[oldest] = nil
    31→			end
    32→			cache[cache_key] = result
    33→			table.insert(cache_order, cache_key)
    34→			return result
    35→		end
    36→	end
    37→	return diagnostic.message
    38→end

    52→		end,

    56→	severity_sort = true,
    57→})

    63→	end,
    64→})

-- pretty-ts-errors formatter (installed via Nix)
local cache = {}
local cache_order = {}
local bin_path = vim.env.PRETTY_TS_ERRORS_BIN or "pretty-ts-errors-markdown"

local function format_ts_diagnostic(diagnostic)
	if diagnostic.source ~= "ts" and diagnostic.source ~= "typescript" then
		return diagnostic.message
	end

	local cache_key = diagnostic.message .. (diagnostic.code or "")
	if cache[cache_key] then
		return cache[cache_key]
	end

	local diagnostic_json = vim.json.encode(diagnostic)
	local handle = io.popen(bin_path .. " -i '" .. diagnostic_json:gsub("'", "'\\''") .. "' 2>/dev/null")
	if handle then
		local prettified = handle:read("*a")
		handle:close()
		if prettified and prettified ~= "" then
			local result = prettified:gsub("^%s*(.-)%s*$", "%1")
			-- remove markdown links
			result = result:gsub("%[([^%]]+)%]%(([^%)]+)%)", "%1")
			-- remove codeblock markers
			result = result:gsub("```%w*\n", ""):gsub("\n```", "")

			if #cache_order >= 3 then
				local oldest = table.remove(cache_order, 1)
				cache[oldest] = nil
			end
			cache[cache_key] = result
			table.insert(cache_order, cache_key)
			return result
		end
	end
	return diagnostic.message
end

-- diagnostic display config
vim.diagnostic.config({
	float = {
		format = format_ts_diagnostic,
		border = "rounded",
		source = true,
	},
	virtual_text = {
		spacing = 4,
		prefix = "●",
		format = function(diagnostic)
			return string.format("%s", diagnostic.message:match("^[^\n]*"))
		end,
	},
	signs = true,
	underline = true,
	severity_sort = true,
})

-- カーソルホールド時に自動でフロート表示
vim.api.nvim_create_autocmd("CursorHold", {
	callback = function()
		vim.diagnostic.open_float(nil, { focusable = false })
	end,
})

-- ホールド時間を短く (デフォルト4000ms → 300ms)

The simplest would be if rustowl already provides a Nix flake that I can just reference as an input, but if not, I might need to use `cargo install` with the necessary Rust components, or create a custom Nix overlay—though that gets tricky with the nightly toolchain requirement. Let me look for any existing Nix configuration in the rustowl repository.

content.thinking:
As I suspected, rustowl requires a nightly Rust toolchain with `rustc-dev` and `llvm-tools` components. This makes building it purely through Nix's `buildRustPackage` very complex.

The options are:
1. Add rustowl's GitHub repo as a flake input and build via Nix (complex, but they might not have a flake)
2. Use the nightly Rust toolchain from nixpkgs
3. Simplest: just ensure `cargo` and `rustup` are available for the neovim build step

Actually, wait. The fact that rustowl needs nightly with `rustc-dev` means even `cargo install rustowl` won't work with a standard cargo - it needs the specific nightly toolchain. 

Since rustowl is a compiler plugin that links against `rustc_driver`, the `cargo install` approach would rely on the crate's `rust-toolchain.toml` to automatically pull the correct nightly version if rustup is available. For a Nix-based system, I need to decide whether to provide rustup with nightly or try to handle this entirely through Nix's Rust infrastructure.

The simplest path forward is probably checking if pre-built binaries exist for rustowl, which would sidestep the whole compilation complexity.

content.text:
完了です。以下の変更を行いました：

**新規ファイル:**
- `nix/overlays/rustowl.nix` — GitHubリリースのプレビルドバイナリ（v0.3.4）をダウンロードするNixオーバレイ。x86_64-linux / aarch64-darwin 両対応
- `nvim/lua/plugins/rustowl.lua` — lazy.nvimプラグイン設定

**変更ファイル:**
- `nix/overlays/default.nix` — rustowl overlayを登録
- `nix/modules/home/programs/neovim.nix` — `extraPackages`に`rustowl`を追加（Nixラップ環境内でバイナリが使えるように）

**使い方:**
- Rustファイルを開くと自動でrustowl LSPクライアントが接続（`auto_attach = true`がデフォルト）
- `:Rustowl enable` で所有権・ライフタイムの可視化を有効化
- `:Rustowl toggle` でオン/オフ切り替え
- ファイル保存時に自動解析、カーソル位置の変数の所有権情報がカラーアンダーラインで表示されます

`nix run .#switch`で適用すれば使えるようになります。

new file mode 100644
index 0000000..bd51807
--- /dev/null
+++ b/nix/overlays/rustowl.nix
@@ -0,0 +1,48 @@
+final: prev:
+let
+  version = "0.3.4";
+  sources = {
+    x86_64-linux = {
+      url = "https://github.com/cordx56/rustowl/releases/download/v${version}/rustowl-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu";
+      hash = "REDACTED";
+    };
+    aarch64-darwin = {
+      url = "https://github.com/cordx56/rustowl/releases/download/v${version}/rustowl-aarch64-apple-darwin";
+      hash = "REDACTED";
+    };
+  };
+  src =
+    sources.${final.stdenv.hostPlatform.system}
+      or (throw "rustowl: unsupported system ${final.stdenv.hostPlatform.system}");
+in
+{
+  rustowl = final.stdenv.mkDerivation {
+    pname = "rustowl";
+    inherit version;
+
+    src = final.fetchurl {
+      inherit (src) url hash;
+    };
+
+    dontUnpack = true;
+
+    nativeBuildInputs = final.lib.optionals final.stdenv.hostPlatform.isLinux [
+      final.autoPatchelfHook
+    ];
+
+    installPhase = ''
+      install -Dm755 $src $out/bin/rustowl
+    '';
+
+    meta = with final.lib; {
+      description = "Visualize ownership and lifetimes in Rust";
+      homepage = "https://github.com/cordx56/rustowl";
+      license = licenses.mit;
+      mainProgram = "rustowl";
+      platforms = [
+        "x86_64-linux"
+        "aarch64-darwin"
+      ];
+    };
+  };
+}
